conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Stream A is located on the far left, Stream B is second from the left, Stream C is third from the left, and Stream D is on the far right.
There are slanted plates: black, white, yellow, and grey, positioned to deflect the streams.
There are three containers at the bottom labeled E (green), F (red), and G (red).

premise: Stream A hits the upper black plate and deflects down/right.
conclusion: Stream A's first deflection is down/right after hitting the black plate.

premise: Stream A hits the lower white plate and deflects down/left.
conclusion: Stream A's second deflection is down/left after hitting the white plate.

premise: Stream A falls into the left-hand pocket.
conclusion: Stream A ends up in container E.

premise: Stream B misses the black plate and first contacts the lower white plate, deflecting down/right.
conclusion: Stream B deflects down/right after hitting the white plate.

premise: Stream B falls directly into the first red pocket.
conclusion: Stream B ends up in container F.

premise: Stream C immediately strikes the yellow plate and deflects down/right.
conclusion: Stream C's first deflection is down/right after hitting the yellow plate.

premise: Stream C hits the grey plate and deflects down/left.
conclusion: Stream C's second deflection is down/left after hitting the grey plate.

premise: Stream C drops into the second red pocket.
conclusion: Stream C ends up in container G.

premise: Stream D clears all plates until striking the grey plate and deflects down/left.
conclusion: Stream D deflects down/left after hitting the grey plate.

premise: Stream D continues into the right-hand white pocket beyond G.
conclusion: Stream D does not end up in containers E, F, or G.
